intro: Chalcas glabra, commonly known as the smooth chalcas, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically smooth and lance-shaped. The plant produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers arranged in composite head structures, typical of the daisy family. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Chalcas glabra is noted for its low-growing habit and is sometimes used in horticultural settings for its ornamental value.
